Key Match Events: Indonesia's national team had to settle for a 2-2 draw against Bahrain at the Bahrain National Stadium.
Omani referee Ahmed Al Kaf made controversial decisions against Indonesia throughout the match.
The second half was given six minutes of added time, but the game ended nine minutes after the regular time.
Bahrain managed to score an equalizer in the 90+9th minute due to the extended injury time.
Post-Match Reflections: The unfair result for Indonesia's national team could potentially lead to a legal challenge, and a rematch could be arranged.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A similar case occurred during the 2016 World Cup Qualifiers, in a match between South Africa and Senegal for the 2018 World Cup.
